item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ownedin3d ownedin3d
item.description:
@ownedin3d wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:11, topic:440843”][quote author=ownedin3d link=topic=543518.msg3984154#msg3984154 date=1335666163]

I will tell you how I did it.
First go to player.java and find this

Above that add this:

Now when you do your dialogues do this:

[code=java]case 9157:
if(c.dialogueAction == 94 && c.yourquestnamehere == 0 || c.yourquestnamehere == 1){
c.getDH().sendDialogues(1003, 949);
c.yourquestnamehere = 1;

}
[/code]Now you can save it in parts.
Now you want to add it in playersave.java.
Open Playersave.java and find } } else if (token.equals("pc-points")) { p.pcPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Above it add:} else if (token.equals("yourquestnamehere")) { p.yourquestnamehere = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Now we are almost done with playersave.java.
Find this still in playersave.java:

haracterfile.write("pc-points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.pcPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.pcPoints).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Above it add:

characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Remember this in playersave: where you see ("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 20);
The number has to be the exact amount of characters between the two quotes ("") In this case it is the number 20. However, I am sure you will change it. Anyways dude goodluck. Hope I helped and here is an example of mine.

case 756: if (c.ancientStones == 0 || c.ancientStones == 1) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1000,npcType); c.ancientStones = 1; } else if (c.ancientStones == 2 || c.ancientStones == 3) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1011,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 4) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1013,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 5) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1015,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 6) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1017,npcType); } else if (c.hasIceStone == 1 && c.hasBloodStone == 1 && c.hasSmokeStone == 1 && c.hasShadowStone == 1 && c.ancientStones == 7 && c.ancientStones == 7) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1019,npcType); c.sendMessage("<shad=35839><img=2><shad=35839><img=2>Quest Complete: You can now use ancient magicks!"); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerAttack); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerStrength); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerHitpoints); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerDefence); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerRanged); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerMagic); c.didAncientStones = 1; c.ancientStones = 10; c.questPoints += 30; } break;That is in actionhandler though.
Edit:
Also about your sendoption stuff I dont exactly understand what you are trying to say but try something like this:
Open dialoguehandler.java and add:

case 9000: sendOption4("First Option", "Second Option", "Third Option", "Fourth Option"); c.dialogueAction = 9000;//Or whatever you want. c.teleAction = 0; c.nextChat = 0; break;
Now each of these will have a different actionbutton in clickingbuttons. I beleive they are cases 9178 - 9181. Good luck again

it gives me this error when i compile [quote]characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length());
characterfile.newLine();[/quote].

About the options, i ment that when you get to choose the option, “Yes”, or “No” when i click one of them, i get the actionbotton in the .bat file, and then i do that i need to do in the clickingbuttons.java, it compiles, but it dosent work in-game.

@Owner Satan i can’t find any good source’s, i really like teamtorva.
[/quote]

That’s not the error.[/quote]

my bad, forgot to copy, but here you go.

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:456: cannot find symbol
symbol : method toStrin(int)
location: class java.lang.Integer
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.TheBankJob), 0, I
nteger.toStrin(p.TheBankJob).length()); 
  ^

Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ownedin3d, post:10, topic:440843”][quote author=Owner satan link=topic=543518.msg3984100#msg3984100 date=1335658804]
I will tell you how I did it.
First go to player.java and find this

Above that add this:

Now when you do your dialogues do this:

[code=java]case 9157:
if(c.dialogueAction == 94 && c.yourquestnamehere == 0 || c.yourquestnamehere == 1){
c.getDH().sendDialogues(1003, 949);
c.yourquestnamehere = 1;

}
[/code]Now you can save it in parts.
Now you want to add it in playersave.java.
Open Playersave.java and find } } else if (token.equals("pc-points")) { p.pcPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Above it add:} else if (token.equals("yourquestnamehere")) { p.yourquestnamehere = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Now we are almost done with playersave.java.
Find this still in playersave.java:

haracterfile.write("pc-points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.pcPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.pcPoints).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Above it add:

characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Remember this in playersave: where you see ("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 20);
The number has to be the exact amount of characters between the two quotes ("") In this case it is the number 20. However, I am sure you will change it. Anyways dude goodluck. Hope I helped and here is an example of mine.

case 756: if (c.ancientStones == 0 || c.ancientStones == 1) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1000,npcType); c.ancientStones = 1; } else if (c.ancientStones == 2 || c.ancientStones == 3) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1011,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 4) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1013,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 5) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1015,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 6) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1017,npcType); } else if (c.hasIceStone == 1 && c.hasBloodStone == 1 && c.hasSmokeStone == 1 && c.hasShadowStone == 1 && c.ancientStones == 7 && c.ancientStones == 7) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1019,npcType); c.sendMessage("<shad=35839><img=2><shad=35839><img=2>Quest Complete: You can now use ancient magicks!"); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerAttack); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerStrength); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerHitpoints); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerDefence); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerRanged); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerMagic); c.didAncientStones = 1; c.ancientStones = 10; c.questPoints += 30; } break;That is in actionhandler though.
Edit:
Also about your sendoption stuff I dont exactly understand what you are trying to say but try something like this:
Open dialoguehandler.java and add:

case 9000: sendOption4("First Option", "Second Option", "Third Option", "Fourth Option"); c.dialogueAction = 9000;//Or whatever you want. c.teleAction = 0; c.nextChat = 0; break;
Now each of these will have a different actionbutton in clickingbuttons. I beleive they are cases 9178 - 9181. Good luck again
[/quote]

it gives me this error when i compile [quote]characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length());
characterfile.newLine();[/quote].

About the options, i ment that when you get to choose the option, “Yes”, or “No” when i click one of them, i get the actionbotton in the .bat file, and then i do that i need to do in the clickingbuttons.java, it compiles, but it dosent work in-game.

@Owner Satan i can’t find any good source’s, i really like teamtorva.[/quote]

That’s not the error.

Now when you do your dialogues do this:

[code=java]case 9157:
if(c.dialogueAction == 94 && c.yourquestnamehere == 0 || c.yourquestnamehere == 1){
c.getDH().sendDialogues(1003, 949);
c.yourquestnamehere = 1;

}
[/code]Now you can save it in parts.
Now you want to add it in playersave.java.
Open Playersave.java and find } } else if (token.equals("pc-points")) { p.pcPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Above it add:} else if (token.equals("yourquestnamehere")) { p.yourquestnamehere = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Now we are almost done with playersave.java.
Find this still in playersave.java:

haracterfile.write("pc-points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.pcPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.pcPoints).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Above it add:

characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Remember this in playersave: where you see ("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 20);
The number has to be the exact amount of characters between the two quotes ("") In this case it is the number 20. However, I am sure you will change it. Anyways dude goodluck. Hope I helped and here is an example of mine.

case 756: if (c.ancientStones == 0 || c.ancientStones == 1) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1000,npcType); c.ancientStones = 1; } else if (c.ancientStones == 2 || c.ancientStones == 3) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1011,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 4) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1013,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 5) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1015,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 6) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1017,npcType); } else if (c.hasIceStone == 1 && c.hasBloodStone == 1 && c.hasSmokeStone == 1 && c.hasShadowStone == 1 && c.ancientStones == 7 && c.ancientStones == 7) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1019,npcType); c.sendMessage("<shad=35839><img=2><shad=35839><img=2>Quest Complete: You can now use ancient magicks!"); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerAttack); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerStrength); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerHitpoints); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerDefence); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerRanged); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerMagic); c.didAncientStones = 1; c.ancientStones = 10; c.questPoints += 30; } break;That is in actionhandler though.
Edit:
Also about your sendoption stuff I dont exactly understand what you are trying to say but try something like this:
Open dialoguehandler.java and add:

case 9000: sendOption4("First Option", "Second Option", "Third Option", "Fourth Option"); c.dialogueAction = 9000;//Or whatever you want. c.teleAction = 0; c.nextChat = 0; break;
Now each of these will have a different actionbutton in clickingbuttons. I beleive they are cases 9178 - 9181. Good luck again :P[/quote]

it gives me this error when i compile

characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length());
characterfile.newLine();
.

About the options, i ment that when you get to choose the option, “Yes”, or “No” when i click one of them, i get the actionbotton in the .bat file, and then i do that i need to do in the clickingbuttons.java, it compiles, but it dosent work in-game.

@Owner Satan i can’t find any good source’s, i really like teamtorva.

item.source: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]

item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

A vast improvement over manually specifying each value to be stored in the player file, is using a HashMap<String, String>.

I’m actually surprised that after all of these years, NOBODY is doing it (aside from the obvious improvements of serializing the Player data).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Owner_satan Owner satan
item.description:
@Owner_satan wrote:

I will tell you how I did it.
First go to player.java and find this

Above that add this:

Now when you do your dialogues do this:

[code=java]case 9157:
if(c.dialogueAction == 94 && c.yourquestnamehere == 0 || c.yourquestnamehere == 1){
c.getDH().sendDialogues(1003, 949);
c.yourquestnamehere = 1;

}
[/code]Now you can save it in parts.
Now you want to add it in playersave.java.
Open Playersave.java and find } } else if (token.equals("pc-points")) { p.pcPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Above it add:} else if (token.equals("yourquestnamehere")) { p.yourquestnamehere = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Now we are almost done with playersave.java.
Find this still in playersave.java:

haracterfile.write("pc-points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.pcPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.pcPoints).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Above it add:

characterfile.write("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere), 0, Integer.toString(p.yourquestnamehere).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Remember this in playersave: where you see ("yourquestnamehere = ", 0, 20);
The number has to be the exact amount of characters between the two quotes ("") In this case it is the number 20. However, I am sure you will change it. Anyways dude goodluck. Hope I helped and here is an example of mine.

case 756: if (c.ancientStones == 0 || c.ancientStones == 1) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1000,npcType); c.ancientStones = 1; } else if (c.ancientStones == 2 || c.ancientStones == 3) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1011,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 4) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1013,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 5) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1015,npcType); } else if (c.ancientStones == 6) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1017,npcType); } else if (c.hasIceStone == 1 && c.hasBloodStone == 1 && c.hasSmokeStone == 1 && c.hasShadowStone == 1 && c.ancientStones == 7 && c.ancientStones == 7) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1019,npcType); c.sendMessage("<shad=35839><img=2><shad=35839><img=2>Quest Complete: You can now use ancient magicks!"); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerAttack); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerStrength); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerHitpoints); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerDefence); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerRanged); c.getPA().addSkillXP(1000000, c.playerMagic); c.didAncientStones = 1; c.ancientStones = 10; c.questPoints += 30; } break;That is in actionhandler though.
Edit:
Also about your sendoption stuff I dont exactly understand what you are trying to say but try something like this:
Open dialoguehandler.java and add:

case 9000: sendOption4("First Option", "Second Option", "Third Option", "Fourth Option"); c.dialogueAction = 9000;//Or whatever you want. c.teleAction = 0; c.nextChat = 0; break;
Now each of these will have a different actionbutton in clickingbuttons. I beleive they are cases 9178 - 9181. Good luck again

item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ownedin3d ownedin3d
item.description:
@ownedin3d wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:440843”]You need to add save points in the quest.
and at certain points within the quest it would write to the character files saying they have reached this far in the quest. it can also be used to make sure they have started a part etc.[/quote]
can you show me how to do?

item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You need to add save points in the quest.
and at certain points within the quest it would write to the character files saying they have reached this far in the quest. it can also be used to make sure they have started a part etc.

item.title: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ownedin3d ownedin3d
item.description:
@ownedin3d wrote:

I’m trying to make a quest on my server, so can someone please explain to me how to make it server, so that when the player logout, he dosen’t need to repeat the quest.
And i’m trying to make a npc to work on “sendOption” but it dosen’t work. iv’e added the dialogueaction in Clickingbuttons, and i have made the case’s in the dialoguehandler and in the actionhandler. it’s all working but the “senOption” is not working, iv’e done this in the clickingbuttons.

case 9157: if(c.dialogueAction == 94) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(1003, 949); }

help me please!

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Can somebody tell me what i'm doing wrong? [PI]
